result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Dale Neill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Sentence imposed:  1 year county jail with huber and zero days for time served.  Fines/Costs  $500 = $1,380.50 plus $250.00 DNA surchareg and $50.00 drug buy money   Case #14CF59 was dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: Greg brought in two money orders, one for $50 for his payment and one for $100 for Melissa's payment.  I entered them both as $100 in error, which was corrected 3-11-19.  Scanned copy of money orders into Greg's case 14CF60 in case either of them inquire.  JT
